Title: GNU cpio: Multiple vulnerabilities
Synopsis:
Two vulnerabilities have been found in GNU cpio, the worst of which
    could result in execution of arbitrary code.

Background.Text: GNU cpio copies files into or out of a cpio or tar archive.

Description.Text:
Two vulnerabilities have been discovered in GNU cpio:

  • The list_file function in GNU cpio contains a heap-based buffer overflow vulnerability (CVE-2014-9112)
  • A directory traversal vulnerability has been found in GNU cpio (CVE-2015-1197)

Impact.Text: A remote attacker may be able to entice a user to open a specially crafted archive using GNU cpio, possibly resulting in execution of arbitrary code, a Denial of Service condition, or overwriting arbitrary files.

Workaround.Text: There is no known workaround at this time.

P.Text: All GNU cpio users should upgrade to the latest version:
